channel.title: Daniel on The Williams Kids – Dillan ♥ Ashley ♥ Dwyane ♥ Bruce
channel.description: Recent content in Daniel on The Williams Kids – Dillan ♥ Ashley ♥ Dwyane ♥ Bruce
channel.copyright: Copyright © 2013-{year} David E. Williams. All rights reserved.

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – March 12, 2020
item.description: Dear, Dillan, Ashley, Dwyane & Daniel, How are all of you doing this week? I hope you have been okay. I often wonder if you are happy or not. I have suffered from depression my entire life and still do. I fear I may have passed this on to you through my actions, poor choices, and of course genetics. I always tell myself if I get to hold you one

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – February 28, 2020
item.description: Dear kids, How have you guys been? I hope you have been behaving and doing well in school. You don’t have to be perfect as long as you try your best thats [sic] what really matters. I love you all so much I tell everyone I know about you guys. You are the best things that ever happened to me. I don’t know very much about you guys anymore, I wish things were

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – February 18, 2020
item.description: Dear Kids, I’m never really sure what to write about & nobody ever writes me back so it makes it harder to write when im [sic] not even sure if my letters are being received. I love you guys and I try to write you so you know that I am always thanking [sic] of you and that I care. I am sorry I have not been writing you as regularly as

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – January 16, 2020
item.description: Dear Children, Hey it’s Dad, today is the 15th of January, that means I have two weeks till my birthday Feb. 2nd. I will be 32, I am getting old lol but I exercise & try not to eat unhealthy so I hope I will still be in good enough shape to play ball or ride a bike with you in the years to come. I can’t wait to see you all again.

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – January 7, 2020
item.description: Dear Kids. Hey it’s Dad, i’m [sic] never sure what i’m [sic] suppose to say or do I lay awake at night and wounder [sic] what I should do. I want to have a relationship with you guys, i’m [sic] just not real sure where to begin or what that will realistically be like at this point. Maybe it’s still too early. but I don’t want to put it off. I have always procrastinated

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – December 30, 2019
item.description: Dear Children, I know it has been a couple of weeks since I have written you guys an actual letter. I have been trying to contact my lawyer to see if the address I have been writing to you at is current. I love you, I wish I knew weather or not you have been getting my letters, I’m going to continue to write & just hope for the best.

item.title: Card from Daniel Moffett – December 20, 2019
item.description: I love and cherish you all with all of my heart. Love Dad.</p * * Card from Daniel Moffett 2019-12-20

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – December 4, 2019
item.description: Dear kids, When I wrote this it was two days before Thanksgiving, they are giving us chicken breasts, mash potatoes & stuffing. A pretty good meal considering. I miss you all so much, I know it seems like forever but this will eventually only be a brief moment in time. I will wait patiently for as long as it takes in order to hold you in my arms again. I love you

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – November 20, 2019
item.description: Dear Children, I love you guys so much I think of you everyday & night. Are you guys going to be doing any Christmas carroling this year? I know people would love to get visits from angels like all of you. I don’t know if you guys ever pay visits to any nursing homes or elderly people, but they love the company. I talk to your grandpa, my father, about twice a week, he is living in Florida

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – November 12, 2019
item.description: Dear Kids, Hey it’s dad, only a week or two left till Thanksgiving, I bet your [sic] excited about all the delicious food your going to have, I love Thanksgiving, getting together with the family and sharing stories and laughs over a big meal. You know there is only about forty days left for Christmas, I hope you have been good so you get lots of presents from Santa Clause [sic] this year.

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – November 1, 2019
item.description: Dear Children, Sorry your Holloween [sic] got rained out, I hope you were still able to do something fun. I hope you know there is not a day that goes by that I do not thank [sic] about you, I love you with all my heart forever & always. I often have dreams of you and your mother, I love to feel like im [sic] with you again, but when

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – October 25, 2019
item.description: Dear Childrens, [sic] Hey cutie pies how are you all doing, hopefully good. I know you must be excited about Holloween [sic] this week, remember to be safe & have fun. Don’t eat too much candy & make sure to brush your teeth, too much sugar is bad for your teeth. They got us the new Lion King movie yesterday. I haven’t watched it yet but I plan on it today.

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – October 18, 2019
item.description: Dear Children, How are you doing im [sic] good. What did you guys do this weekend & did you guys have school monday [sic] or were you off for Colombus day [sic]. I had monday [sic] off from the classes im [sic] going to. Thanksgiving is in just a few more weeks. I hope you have a nice big dinner with all of the family. Have you been good this year cause Christmas is

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – October 10, 2019
item.description: Dear Dillan, Ashley, Dwyane & Daniel, Hey kids this is your father Daniel. how are your guys doing this week? Did you guys have a fun weekend, even as an adult my favorite part of the week is the weekend. It’s the time to rest, reflect, and spend time with God so you can thank him for all the blessings he has given you all week. I love all of you guys so much, just thanking [sic] of you brings

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – October 2, 2019
item.description: Dear Kids, Hey this is your dad Daniel. How have you guys been? I’ve been good, have you seen any of the new Disney remakes like Cinderella, Beauty and the beast, or Alladin? I recently watched all three they were pretty good but I still kind of like the original cartoon versions. I thank [sic] my favorite were probably either The little toaster or the fox and the hound. The little toaster is really cute, ask

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – September 9, 2019
item.description: Dear Dave & Lesa, Hey how are you and the children? I am doing good. It would be really nice to hear from you and the children. I hope you are willing to allow the children to receive my letters or will read to them what you feel is appropriate for them to receive, as well as allowing them to contact me if they so choose. If you do not feel as though it is appropriate for us to write each other

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – July 1, 2019
item.description: Dear Dillan, Ashley, Dwyane & Daniel. This is your father Daniel, How are you guys doing? im doing good and im healthy. Happy late birthday Dillan, Ashley & Daniel, and happy early birthday Dwyane. I’m sorry I have missed so many of your birthdays. I wish I could be there, but I can’t right now. How does it feel being a big 10 this year Dillan? You really are a big boy now!

item.title: Status Update – April 1, 2019
item.description: Back to school/work. Made appointment with H&R Block. Picked up kids, lots of April Fools jokes. Took all kids to Scouts, Bruce/Lions cleaned park, Ashley helped, playground afterward. Picked up PO Box letter from Daniel, still incarcerated, Lesa and I kind of upset over content.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 27, 2019
item.description: Ashley: How come we don’t go to foster training anymore? Dave: Lesa and I got tired and decided to focus on taking care of you guys the best we can. Besides, we kind of don’t have the room for another foster kid. Ashley: When we get our new place and have the extra room maybe we can get a girl. I think it would be nice to have a girl around.

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – January 10, 2019
item.description: Dear, David and Lisa. This is Daniel. This letter is long overdue, and the truth is I have been a little scared to write it. There are so many things to say and ask, but I guess the best way is to take it one step at a time and start at the Beginning. Thank you so much for everything you do, you have been a mericle for me and the children.

item.title: Letter to Rebecca Moffett – December 19, 2018
item.description: Hi Rebecca, We received your letter of July 16. We rented a PO Box from the United States Postal Service expressly for correspondence with Daniel and Nicolle. Clay Cummings, Daniel’s lawyer at the time, alerted us to an issue. It appeared mail sent to it was either returned or lost. We have no idea what was sent or what we missed. We were unable to convince the USPS of the problem.

item.title: Status Update – October 18, 2018
item.description: Same old morning/workday/afternoon. Finished antibiotics, feel much better than a month ago, wish Lesa would get better too. Kids watched TV. Jordan finished PAVA pics, they’re awesome! Backgrounds and Facebook immediately! Spent evening ordering for Nicolle, Daniel, and Rebecca.

item.title: Letter from Rebecca Moffett – July 16, 2018
item.description: Dear David and Lesa Williams, July 16, 2018 I am the mother of Daniel Moffett. I received a letter from you a while ago and tried to respond a few times since. Both letters I mailed to the P.O. Box address given to me in your letter. Both were returned to me as undeliverable. I verified the address and tried again only to have that one returned as well. So

item.title: PAVA Letter 2018
item.description: Hi Daniel and Nicolle, We had a good year. We took a vacation to Kentucky, went on a paddleboat ride on the Ohio and went to the Newport Aquarium. We went to the Children’s Museum. Monster Jam in February was huge. We’ve been to basketball, soccer, and baseball games. We’ve been boating on Monroe Reservoir, ice skating, roller skating, several festivals including IU’s STEM festival, bowling, to movies and a drive-in theatre.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – October 11, 2017
item.description: Ashley, talking about her bio-parents: They hurt Dillan more on the inside where you can’t see, and they hurt me more on the outside where you can see.

item.title: The Outreach Summer/Fall Edition 2017 – Open Arms
item.description: Open Arms Christian Ministries News & Media We are Dave and Lesa Williams. We worked with youth as Sunday School teachers but have no biological children. We attended an Open Arms presentation at church and a few years later we were licensed. We both work full time, thought school age a good fit, so we requested one child five or older. Awaiting our first placement, we respited a sibling group of four: Dillan 4, Ashley 3, Dwyane 19m, and Bruce 7m.

item.title: Letter from Daniel Moffett – June 29 12, 2017
item.description: Dear, David, Lisa, Dillan, Ashley, Dwyane & Daniel I hope you are all Doing well I am no longer in any trouble. I was not able to receive your last letter however they did tell me the address that was on the invelope [sic] so if you can please let me know what it said. my new address is 1834 Toucan Way Unit 1301 Sarasota, FL, 34232 I live in florida [sic] now.

item.title: PAVA Letter 2017
item.description: Hi. This is my first time writing something like this and I hope I do a good job describing the kids for you. I didn’t have a clue what to write so Lesa and I jotted down things that came to mind. Then we listed some activities they’ve done as individuals and with us as a family. Then I tried to organize those in a meaningful way and tried to fill in blanks and add details.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – February 27, 2017
item.description: Ashley, asking about our PAVA PO Box: Was anything in it?

item.title: Letter from Rebecca Moffett – December 22, 2016
item.description: December 22, 2016 Dear David and Lesa Williams, I was touched to receive your letter last night. First, I would like to personally thank you both for taking in and caring for Daniel’s babies. As a single mother, I know how difficult and yet how rewarding raising children can be. I felt extreme guilt for not being able to take them in myself, but my prayers were answered, when a lovely couple, such as yourselves, were willing to keep the kids together.

item.title: Stephanie Helton Email – Namesakes for the Children
item.description: I’m passing this along to you. Stephanie Helton, FCM – Martin Co.   Good Morning, Ms. Hulsey requested that I provide the namesakes for the children to you so that you can provide it to the foster/adoptive parents.   Dillan Levi – I choose Dillan’s first name the day he was born, the moment I saw his face the name came to me. I picked Levi as his middle name after a dear family friend who had passed, Dustin Levi Kelley.

item.title: Caron Hulsey to David E. Williams – Facebook Messenger
item.description: Sorry to bother you,I’ve wanted to talk to you and your wife for months,have you gotten to adopt my grangchildren yet,if this hasn’t happened I would like Nicolle to sighn her rights over to you and your wife,it’s been hard fighting for them,having to let them go,it’s ts like they passed away,it’s st has affected Nicolle horribly,itststts painful for all of us,itststts feel there better having a good father figure,daniel is mental from his mother abusing him.

item.title: Police log for Jan. 21, 2016 – Times-Mail
item.description: Times-Mail Police log for Jan. 21, 2016 Police log for Jan. 21, 2016 Lawrence Co. Police Dept. Arrests Jan. 20 11:21 a.m. Daniel Moffett, 27, Shelbyville, wanted on a warrant for theft, criminal mischief. * * Police log for Jan. 21, 2016

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – September 16, 2015
item.description: Dillan: Daddy? Dave: What? Dillan: Why do people keep giving us swimming pools? Dave: People give us things because they want to help us. Dillan: Why? Dave: People want to help us because they want to show God’s love through them, and because they know how expensive and hard it must be to take care of four kids that aren’t our kids yet, and because they want to make you kids feel better and have fun and not be sad.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 20, 2015
item.description: Ashley: My other mom and dad only fed us cereal and hot dogs. And Kathy fed us cereal and lots of stuff. And I like the stuff God feeds us. [Food from our garden.] And you feed us lots and lots of good stuff and I like it the best.

item.title: Kid Quote of the Day – August 4, 2015
item.description: [Dillan and I were sitting on the stairs at church. We were discussing why he was disruptive during Sunday School. He was biting his lower lip and his whole body was trembling. I could tell he wanted to tell me something but was afraid to. I put my arm around him to comfort him.] Dave: It’s okay Dillan. You can tell me. It will be okay. [Dillan remained quite and just looked at me.

item.title: Status Update – April 10, 2015
item.description: Mom and Dad Moffett declined self-termination. End of the school week. Pizza night. Nothing else special happened. Busy day tomorrow.

item.title: Status Update – April 8, 2015
item.description: Slow start again! Tornado siren was exciting for kids. Stephanie called and needs photos for possible self-termination by parents on Friday.

item.title: Daviess County Sheriff’s Report – Loogootee Tribune
item.description: Daviess County Sheriff’s Report Thursday, March 26, 2015 Loogootee Tribune … Mar 18, 2015 – Nicole Hulsey, 23, of Washington, was arrested and charged with manufacturing methamphetamine, maintain a common nuisance, possession of a hypodermic syringe, possession of paraphernalia, possession of marijuana/hashish, and possession of methamphetamine. Bond was set at $15,000. Mar 18, 2015 – Daniel Moffett, 27, of Shelbyville, was arrested and charged with manufacturing methamphetamine, resisting law enforcement, possession of marijuana/hashish, maintaining a common nuisance, and possession of paraphernalia.

item.title: Meth bust – WAMW 107.9 FM
item.description: Meth bust Thursday, March 19, 2015 WAMW 107.9 FM Two people were jailed in Washington for making meth and other charges on Wednesday. Washington police logs state officers got into a foot pursuit on Dewey and South Meridian at 5:22-pm on Wednesday. 27-year-old Daniel Keith Moffett was apprehended on Southeast 1st. During the investigation, police interviewed 23-year-old Nicole Hulsey. Later a state police lab team was contacted and after search warrants were obtained and served, both Moffett and Hulsey were arrested for manufacturing meth, possession of marijuana and maintaining a common nuisance.

item.title: Daviess County Arrests – WWBL 106.5 FM
item.description: http://www.wwbl.com/daviess-co-arrests/ by John Szink on March 19, 2015 Washington Police arrested 27-year-old Daniel Moffett of Shelbyville Wednesday for Manufacturing Methamphetamine, Resisting Law Enforcement, Possession of Marijuana and Paraphernalia and Maintaining a Common Nuisance. Bond was set at $12,000. City police also arrested 23-year-old Nicole Hulsey of Washington Wednesday for Manufacturing Meth, Maintaining a Common Nuisance, Possession of a Hypodermic Syringe, Paraphernalia, Marijuana and Methamphetamine. Hulsey is being held without bond.

item.title: Loogootee Man Arrested After Breaking Into Doctor’s Office – WBIW 1340 AM
item.description: WBIW 1340 AM – Loogootee Man Arrested After Breaking Into Doctor’s Office (LOOGOOTEE) – On Tuesday, Loogootee Police arrested 25-year-old Daniel Moffett, of Loogootee, on a charge of burglary. Police say Moffett broke into Dr. Yoon’s Medical Office in Loogootee. Moffett was taken to the Martin County Security Center.

item.title: Washington Times Herald – Births Published the Week of July 13 to 18
item.description: The Washington Times Herald Monday, July 20, 2009 Births Published the Week of July 13 to 18 View Births published the week of July 13 to 18 PDF Dillan Levi Moffett Nicolle Leann Hulsey and Daniel Keith Moffett announce the birth of their son, Dillan Levi Moffett. He was born at 1:38 a.m. July 1 at Daviess Community Hospital. He weighed 8 lbs., 1 oz. and was 21 inches long.
